page.title: 02HILL FARM - HAY MOOR
page.content: Hill Farm has been in the same family for three generations.It's a dairy farm and covers 230 acres.The farmer and his wife work the farm on their own but have a contractor to help with silaging. Their land on Hay Moor floods two or three times a year, but despite this the farmer said it was ideal milking land.It was particularly good in the dry summer. It is a Friesian herd of 129 cows and they keep one Hereford bull.They have a milking parlour for twenty and milk twice a day at 6am. and 4pm.They pro- duce between a thousand and one thousand-five hundred litres per day. In 1983 they installed a computer system for feeding the herd.Each cow now wears a microchip round her neck.
